H0.text: Who is the nude bow-carrying statue in London's Piccadilly Circus. Eros

H1.text: Who is the nude bow-carrying statue in London's Piccadilly Circus. Cupid

H2.text: Who is the nude bow-carrying statue in London's Piccadilly Circus. Apollo

H3.text: Who is the nude bow-carrying statue in London's Piccadilly Circus. Anteros

A4.text: The statue was created as an image of Anteros, the Greek god's brother, not Eros.

A5.text: Gilbert described Anteros as portraying 'reflective and mature love, as opposed to Eros or Cupid, the frivolous tyrant.'

A6.text: Gilbert had already sculpted a statue of Anteros and, when commissioned for the Shaftesbury Memorial Fountain, chose to reproduce the same subject, who, as 'The God of Selfless Love' was deemed to represent the philanthropic 7th Earl of Shaftesbury suitably.
